MethodHandlers

Class POSTHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • MethodHandlers.MethodHandler
      • MethodHandlers.POSTHandler

  • public class POSTHandler
extends MethodHandler
    Implementation of the POST method - Handles/Serves POST requests that are sent with a tag of multipart/form-data (standard protocol for uploading files) Stores the incoming file in the server's home directory back the content type, content length and the content of the file requested if authorized resource is found to exist
    Author:
    rtalwar

    • Method Detail

      • validateRequest

        public boolean validateRequest()
        validates the incoming request checks for content type content length and fills/initializes the int internal data structures to help further processing
        Returns:
        true if the request is a valid, else false

      • getField

        public java.lang.String getField(java.lang.String req,
                        java.lang.String field,
                        char delim)
        Gets the value of a field - key in the present request
        Parameters:
        req - the parent string in which to fetch
        field - the field or key name to fetch (-- includes every char before the value to be taken)
        delim - the char which separates the value from other elements in the string
        Returns:
        the value of the field present between the given field and delim

        public void getNewName(int num)

        Parameters:

      • rwdata

        public int rwdata()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the content length data from the stream and writes it to the stream
        Returns:
        0 if the file written successfully 1 if the file could not be created at the given place signifying internal error due to permissions etc 2 if the line was not written successfully
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
